## IDEA 
A normal solar panel convert only 30 to 40 percent of solar radiation into electrical energy. To get constant output we also need a automated system which can keep rotating the solar panel. To solve this problem we need a dual axis solar sun traker which is completely automatic and keep the solar panel in front of the sun all the time till it is visible. The unique feature of this system is that instead of taking the earth as its reference, it takes the sun as a guiding source. Its active sensors constantly monitor the sunlight and rotate the panel towards the direction where the intensity of sunlight is maximum

## WORKING PRINCIPAL
A dual axis sun traker use an controller that moniters the position of sun's movement in order to direct motor that move the trackers.
The trackers, light dependent resister or LDRs are used as an sensor. LDR1 and LDR2 are used to track horizontal axis (x-axis). When LDR2 receives more light than LDR1, it offers lower resistance than LDR1. When LDR1 receives more light than LDR2, it offers lower resistance than LDR2, giving a low input to comparators. Similarly, LDR3, and LDR4 track the sun along Y axis.

## MAKING OF PROJECT
1. LDRs are used as the main light sensors. Two servo motors are fixed to the structure that holds the solar panel. The program for Arduino is uploaded to the microcontroller. 
2. LDRs sense the amount of sunlight falling on them. Four LDRs are divided into top, bottom, left and right.
3. For east â€“ west tracking, the analog values from two top LDRs and two bottom LDRs are compared and if the top set of LDRs receive more light, the vertical servo will move in that direction.
4. If the bottom LDRs receive more light, the servo moves in that direction.
5. For angular deflection of the solar panel, the analog values from two left LDRs and two right LDRs are compared. If the left set of LDRs receive more light than the right set, the horizontal servo will move in that direction
6. If the right set of LDRs receive more light, the servo moves in that direction.
<br>

## PRACTICAL APPLICATION 
1. Dual axis sun tracker can be used for large & medium scale power generations
2. It can also be used for power generation at remote places.
3. It may be used as domestic power backup systems.
4. It can be used in solar street lighting system
5. It may be used in water treatment technologies and solar heating,

## FUTURE SCOPE
1. Improving the mechanical structure of solar power generation.
2. Improving the load carrying capacity of solar panel.
3. Making solar panel more efficient.
4. Adjusting the gear ratio to decrease energy loss.
5. Stopping the motors while there is no need of movement.
6. Reducing the cost of mechanical structure and making whole system more cost effective.
